item.title: "The Rising Tide of Pink Fascism"
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“Creme de la Creme, post:66, topic:272153”][quote author=PeterMan link=topic=359087.msg2749446#msg2749446 date=1239828142]

Jesus, I didn’t know Americans were so strongly opposed to gay marriage. Nobody in England seems to care that much.

Yh americans think homosexuality is a disease.

We had a vote in the state of ohio where I live here a few years ago to ban gay marriage. I, along with 80-85% or so of the other voters in the state approved it, making it a constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage in our state. I am still glad I did it, and I’d do it again.

I’m just wondering, why?

I don’t believe gay people should be allowed to marry. I believe being gay is a choice, and a wrong one at that, so two gay people cannot be ‘in love’ like heterosexual people and should therefore not be married. Some people say gay marriage takes away from the sanctity of marriage, and I would tend to agree, it kind of makes a joke out of marriage, which degrades real marriage.

I’m gay and actually don’t want to be. If I had a choice I’d be 100% straight. Or maybe I’m just sexually confused…

Fag
[/quote]
omg stop calling me a homo before I make a video on youtube about it[/quote]

saying you don’t want to be gay is just asking to be called a fag.

Read full topic

We had a vote in the state of ohio where I live here a few years ago to ban gay marriage. I, along with 80-85% or so of the other voters in the state approved it, making it a constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage in our state. I am still glad I did it, and I’d do it again.

item.title: "The Rising Tide of Pink Fascism"
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:60, topic:272153”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=359087.msg2747617#msg2747617 date=1239728181]

Sure, but why aren’t conversely some gay marriages based on love then?

I just don’t believe they can be, it’s not natural.

what about those idiots that fall in love with cars and robots? its still love no matter how disturbed. I dont agree they should get married but i agree that they can fall in love
[/quote]
What about the Japanese guy who wanted to marry (or something similar) a video game character?
That’d be amusing if they allowed it.[/quote]
lol i’d imagine someone somewhere would make him pay copyright every time he jacked off over her

item.title: "The Rising Tide of Pink Fascism"
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

KILL ALL THEM QUEERS!!! TIE 'EM UP BEHIND MY F-350 AND WE’ll DRAG EM THROUGH TOWN. THEN WE’LL BURN 'EM LIKE THE FLAMERS THEY ARE.

Seriously though, I do oppose gay marriage. I’m also very homophobic(not at all times), and seeing two homosexuals holding hands or embracing each other romantically, disgusts me. I’m pretty open when it comes to sexual preference, and I’m OK with being around homosexuals.

It’s just seeing two Gay people together in a store, or a restaurant is awkward for me. I’m sure that is just society’s influence on me, and because it’s not acceptable in most of society I automatically have distaste for it. But I still don’t like it, regardless of how the seed was planted.

Read full topic

item.title: "The Rising Tide of Pink Fascism"
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Moparisthebest:

As to the issue of gay people ‘loving’ each other, I don’t believe they can have that same kind of love connection that a real couple can have, in fact I would call it lust because their whole relationship is based off of sex, where as a relationship between a man and a woman is based off of being there for each other and supporting each other in everything.

Why can two people of the same sex not be there for eachother or support eachother?

I don’t think it’s oestrogen that makes men gay, it just gives them big tits.

Read full topic

[/quote]

item.title: "The Rising Tide of Pink Fascism"
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Mopman:

Why do i get the feeling this causes debate in the -isthebest household?

Not really, because we learned long ago it is the only thing we don’t agree on so we don’t talk about it.

R.I.P RSC:

Having sex with the same sex doesn’t mean you are gay. Yes, probably only gay people do it, but it’s not the definition of gay.

I believe it is the definition of gay. That is what I am talking about when I use the term gay.

As to the issue of gay people ‘loving’ each other, I don’t believe they can have that same kind of love connection that a real couple can have, in fact I would call it lust because their whole relationship is based off of sex, where as a relationship between a man and a woman is based off of being there for each other and supporting each other in everything.

Read full topic
